00046 RowFile::RowFile(char delimChar, char commentChar, char commentChar2):
00047    m_Buffer(NULL), m_BufferSize(0), m_LineIx(0),
00048   m_Delim(delimChar), m_Comment(commentChar), m_Comment2(commentChar2), 
00049   m_Reuse(false) {
00050 }

00056 void RowFile::open(const char *fileName) {
00057   m_FileName = string(fileName);
00058   m_In.open(fileName, ios_base::in);
00059   if(m_In.fail()) {
00060     Err::errAbort("Can't open file " + string(fileName) + " to read.");
00061   }
00062   m_EndType = determineLineEndingType(m_In);
00063 }
00064 
00068 RowFile::~RowFile() { 
00069   if(m_Buffer) {
00070     delete[] m_Buffer;
00071   } 
00072   if(m_In.is_open()) { 
00073     m_In.close(); 
00074   }
00075 };

00080 void RowFile::close() {
00081   m_In.close();
00082 }

00090 const string *RowFile::nextLine() {
00091   
00092   /* If we're reusing this line just return it again. */
00093   if(m_Reuse) {
00094     m_Reuse = false;
00095     return &m_CurrentLine;
00096   }
00097   /* if end of file return NULL. */
00098   if(m_In.eof())
00099     return NULL;
00100   /* Check stream state. */
00101   if(m_In.fail())
00102     Err::errAbort("Something bad happened before line: " + 
00103                     ToStr(m_LineIx));
00104 
00105   /* Little logic to handle the different line endings possible. */
00106   if(m_EndType == MAC) {
00107     getline(m_In, m_CurrentLine, '\r');
00108   }
00109   else { 
00110     getline(m_In, m_CurrentLine, '\n');
00111     // if ms-dos chop off the '\r'
00112     if(m_EndType == DOS && m_CurrentLine.length() > 0) 
00113       m_CurrentLine.erase(m_CurrentLine.end() - 1);
00114   }
00115   Util::trimString(m_CurrentLine);
00116   m_LineIx++;
00117   return &m_CurrentLine;
00118 }
00119 
00126 const string *RowFile::nextRealLine() {
00127   unsigned int notWhiteSpace = 0;
00128   while( nextLine() != NULL) {
00129     notWhiteSpace = 0;
00130     // Skip the first not white space.
00131     while(notWhiteSpace < m_CurrentLine.size() &&
00132           isspace(m_CurrentLine[notWhiteSpace]))
00133       notWhiteSpace++;
00134     // If found we found a line with characters that doesn't start
00135     // with a comment return true.
00136     if(m_CurrentLine.size() != 0 && 
00137        m_CurrentLine[notWhiteSpace] != m_Comment && 
00138        m_CurrentLine[notWhiteSpace] != m_Comment2)
00139       return &m_CurrentLine;
00140   }
00141   // never found a real line.
00142   return NULL;
00143 }
00144 
00150 bool RowFile::nextRow(std::vector<std::string> &words) {
00151   int len = 0, start = 0, next = 0;
00152 
00153   if(nextRealLine() == NULL)
00154     return false;
00155   words.clear();
00156   len = m_CurrentLine.size();
00157 
00158   while(start < len) {
00159     next = (int)m_CurrentLine.find(m_Delim, start);
00160     if(next < 0) {
00161       next = m_CurrentLine.size(); // entire string.
00162     }
00163     words.push_back(m_CurrentLine.substr(start, next - start));
00164     start = next+1;
00165   }
00166   return true;
00167 }
00168 
00176 bool RowFile::nextCStringRowExpect(std::vector<const char *> &words, unsigned int expect) {
00177   if(!nextCStringRow(words))
00178     return false;
00179   if(words.size() != expect) {
00180     Err::errAbort("Got " + ToStr(words.size()) +
00181                     " words instead of " + ToStr(expect) +
00182                     " expected at line: " + ToStr(m_LineIx));
00183   }
00184   return true;
00185 }
00186 
00194 bool RowFile::nextCStringRow(std::vector<const char *> &words) {
00195   int len = 0, start = 0, next = 0;
00196   char *mark = 0;
00197   char *buff = 0;
00198 
00199   if(nextRealLine() == NULL)
00200     return false;
00201   words.clear();
00202   len = m_CurrentLine.size();
00203 
00204   /* Use the m_Buffer to copy strings into to avoid lots of new's and
00205      deletes. Only expand when necessary. */
00206   if(len + 1 > m_BufferSize) {
00207     FreezArray(m_Buffer);
00208     m_BufferSize = len+1;
00209      m_Buffer = new char[m_BufferSize];
00210   }
00211   //strncpy(m_Buffer, m_CurrentLine.c_str(), len);
00212   memcpy(m_Buffer, m_CurrentLine.c_str(), len);
00213   buff = m_Buffer;
00214   
00215   /* Trim off any delimiters at beginning and end of line */
00216   while(start < len) {
00217     if(!isspace(m_CurrentLine[start])) 
00218       break;
00219     start++;
00220   }
00221   while(len > start) {
00222     if(!isspace(m_CurrentLine[len -1]))
00223       break;
00224     m_Buffer[len - 1] = '\0';
00225     len--;
00226   }
00227 
00228   /* Loop through and cut up lines into words based on delimiter. */
00229   while(start < len) {
00230     next = (int)m_CurrentLine.find(m_Delim, start);
00231     if(next < 0) {
00232       next = m_CurrentLine.size(); // entire string.
00233     }
00234     mark = buff+next;
00235     *mark = '\0';
00236     words.push_back(buff+start);
00237     start = next+1;
00238   }
00239   return true;
00240 }

00250 bool RowFile::nextRowExpect(std::vector<std::string> &words, unsigned int expect) {
00251   if(!nextRow(words))
00252     return false;
00253   if(words.size() != expect) {
00254     Err::errAbort("Got " + ToStr(words.size()) +
00255                     " words instead of " + ToStr(expect) +
00256                     " expected at line: " + ToStr(m_LineIx));
00257   }
00258   return true;
00259 }
00260   
00261 void RowFile::readHeader(RowFile &rf, std::map<std::string, std::vector<std::string> > &header,
00262                          std::vector<std::string> &lines) {
00263   char delim = '=';
00264   int startPos = 0;
00265   string::size_type delimPos = 0;
00266   const string *line = NULL;
00267   while((line = rf.nextLine()) != NULL) {
00268     startPos = 0;
00269     /* Header is prefixed by '%' or "#%" */
00270     if(line->length() == 0)
00271       continue;
00272     else if(line->length() > 1 && (*line)[0] == rf.m_Comment && (*line)[1] == rf.m_Comment2)
00273       startPos = 2;
00274     else if(line->length() > 0 && (*line)[0] == rf.m_Comment2)
00275       startPos = 1;
00276     else {
00277       rf.reuseLine();
00278       break;
00279     }    
00280     lines.push_back(string(*line));
00281     delimPos = line->find(delim);
00282     if(delimPos == string::npos) 
00283       Err::errAbort("Couldn't find delimiter: '" + ToStr(delim) + 
00284                       "' in line:\n" + string(*line));
00285     string key = line->substr(startPos, delimPos-startPos);
00286     string value = line->substr(delimPos+1, line->length());
00287     if(header.find(key) == header.end()) {
00288       // first time seen, create a new vector of values.
00289       vector<string> vals;
00290       vals.push_back(value);
00291       header[key] = vals;
00292     }
00293     else {
00294       vector<string> &vals = header[key];
00295       vals.push_back(value);
00296     }
00297   }   
00298 }

00303 void RowFile::writeHeader(std::ostream &out, const std::vector<std::string> &lines) {
00304   typedef vector<string>::const_iterator vecI;
00305   vecI i;
00306   for(i = lines.begin(); i != lines.end(); ++i) 
00307     out << *i << endl;
00308 }

00317 void RowFile::matrixFromFile(const char *fileName, std::vector< std::vector<double> > &matrix,
00318                unsigned int skipLines, unsigned int skipCols) {
00319   RowFile rf;
00320   unsigned int i = 0;
00321   vector<string> words;
00322   rf.open(fileName);
00323   for(i = 0; i < skipLines; i++)
00324     rf.nextRow(words);
00325   while(rf.nextRow(words)) {
00326     if(skipCols >= words.size()) 
00327       Err::errAbort("RowFile::matrixFromFile() - Number of skipCols >= number of cols.");
00328     matrix.push_back(vector<double>());
00329     for(i = skipCols; i < words.size(); i++) {
00330       matrix[matrix.size() -1].push_back(Convert::toDouble(words[i].c_str()));
00331     }
00332   }
00333 }
00334 
00342 void RowFile::matrixFromFile(const char *fileName, std::vector< std::vector<float> > &matrix,
00343                unsigned int skipLines, unsigned int skipCols) {
00344   RowFile rf;
00345   unsigned int i = 0;
00346   vector<string> words;
00347   rf.open(fileName);
00348   for(i = 0; i < skipLines; i++)
00349     rf.nextRow(words);
00350   while(rf.nextRow(words)) {
00351     if(skipCols >= words.size()) 
00352       Err::errAbort("RowFile::matrixFromFile() - Number of skipCols >= number of cols.");
00353     matrix.push_back(vector<float>());
00354     for(i = skipCols; i < words.size(); i++) {
00355       matrix[matrix.size() -1].push_back(Convert::toFloat(words[i].c_str()));
00356     }
00357   }
00358 }

00360 
00366 enum RowFile::FileLineEnding RowFile::determineLineEndingType(std::ifstream &input) {
00367   FileLineEnding ending = UNKNOWN;
00368   while(input.good()) {
00369     char c1 = input.get();
00370     // '\r' alone indicates mac, '\r\n' indicates dos
00371     if(c1 == '\r') {
00372       if(input.good() && input.get() == '\n') {
00373         ending = DOS;
00374       }
00375       else {
00376         ending = MAC;
00377       }
00378       break;
00379     }
00380     // is it a unix file?
00381     else if(c1 == '\n') {
00382       ending = UNIX;
00383       break;
00384     }
00385   }
00386   // reset stream back to beginning of file.
00387   input.seekg(0);
00388   return ending;
00389 }
